name: The King
descriptions: The King is an Elvis impersonator who leads a gang called the "Kings," operating out of the School of Impersonation located in southern Freeside in 2281.

Unlike other gangs in the Mojave Wasteland, the Kings are built on respect and do not look for their next fight or skirmish. Instead, the Kings are staunch anarchists that believe in complete personal freedom and that "every man is a king in

The King's righthand man is Pacer, a childhood friend who sometimes tends to undermine his peaceful intentions. The Kings largely lets him do as he pleases unabated; tolerating his unscrupulous and violent tendencies towards strangers and squatters.

The King also owns a cyberdog named Rex that he bought from a prospector a few years ago. Rex has always been nothing but a cyberhound, but The King has become concerned for Rex as his brain is beginning to degrade, and hopes that traveling with the Courier will allow him to get the help he needs and give him a little more bite and a little less bark.

PC Playstation 3 If one speaks to The King about joining the Kings before the completion of his quest Nothin' But a Hound Dog, he might decline. Returning later after completing it, the option will not be reopened, (unless The King owes you a favor which is earned in another mission) and it will be thereafter impossible to join the King's gang. It is uncertain if this is a bug or intentional.
role: The Kings gang leaderKing of Spades

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Look, Rexie, someone new's come to see us.{Sighs}Poor boy. He hasn't been feeling well lately. I'm the King. What can I do for you?

topics.topic_text: VEndingKings
topics.response_text: {Narrating}With the King dead and most of their gang slain by the Courier, the remaining Kings fled the area, never to be heard from again.

topics.topic_text: VFSKingHsuOfferStart
topics.response_text: Let me guess. The NCR couldn't get me to dance to their tune so now they're asking again a little less nicely, right?

topics.topic_text: VFSKingSendsPlayerAfterPacer
topics.response_text: I want you to back him up. See this through, and there'll be something good waiting for you when you get back.

topics.topic_text: VFSKingSendsPlayerToNegotiate
topics.response_text: What is that fool doing? I need you to head out there and try to defuse the situation. Tell them I'm willing to cooperate.

topics.topic_text: VFSKingUltimatumStart
topics.response_text: Let me guess. The NCR couldn't get me to dance to their tune so now they're asking again a little less nicely, right?

topics.topic_text: 50 caps.
topics.response_text: That's Pace for you. He means well, but he doesn't like strangers. Here, to make amends.

topics.topic_text: 500 caps.
topics.response_text: You're kidding me, right? No, from the look in your eye I can tell you're not kidding. Wow, you should really be more careful with your money.

topics.topic_text: It's not worth mentioning.
topics.response_text: You're modest. I respect that. So what can I do for you?

topics.topic_text: Nothing, I talked my way in.
topics.response_text: Pace must be losing his touch. Either that or you're a smooth one. So what can I do for you?

topics.topic_text: I'm looking for a way into the Strip.
topics.response_text: I might just be able to help you with that. But it's not something I do easily, or often. You'd have to earn it. You willing to do that?

topics.topic_text: Sure. What do I have to do?
topics.response_text: I'll start you off with something easy. Did you notice the bodyguards for hire near the gates when you entered Freeside?

topics.topic_text: Not really. I guess I'll go find another way.
topics.response_text: Then I wish you luck. But know that there are only two ways in there, me or those robots. Good luck working things out with the tin cans.

topics.topic_text: Yes.
topics.response_text: It's good money if you can stay alive long enough. Freeside's not as safe as it used to be, so the money is well earned.

topics.topic_text: Sure, I've got one waiting outside for me.
topics.response_text: It's good money if you can stay alive long enough. Freeside's not as safe as it used to be, so the money is well earned.

topics.topic_text: Sure.
topics.response_text: Okay, then. Once you part ways, return here. I'll look forward to hearing your report. Oh, and take this to cover the hiring cost.

topics.topic_text: Why are you so interested in this?
topics.response_text: You may have noticed that some of those guards out there are Kings, too. I'm just looking out for my men.

topics.topic_text: Why can't your men look into this?
topics.response_text: I've tried, but he can smell a King a mile away. Probably knows all our faces by now. He's not a stupid man, I'll give him that.

topics.topic_text: I have better things to do.
topics.response_text: That's too bad. We could have helped each other out. If you change your mind, stop back. The job might still be waiting for you.

topics.topic_text: Orris is a fraud. He fakes attacks on his clients and then plays hero.
topics.response_text: So that's how it happens... Okay, then. I'll have some guys pull him off the street when no one's looking.

topics.topic_text: Not much. He seemed legit to me.
topics.response_text: Oh he did, did he? Well that just ain't good enough. Get back out there and hire him again. Hire him a hundred times if that's what it takes.

topics.topic_text: Orris shouldn't be a problem any longer.
topics.response_text: Ah, so it went down like that, huh? I guess it can't be helped now.

topics.topic_text: About that favor you owe me...
topics.response_text: Ask away.

topics.topic_text: I need you to stop the violence against NCR citizens in Freeside.
topics.response_text: So I'm supposed to just start giving in to the demands of random strangers that come in here, huh? I don't think so.

topics.topic_text: The NCR is distributing supplies in a building down by the old train station.
topics.response_text: Handing out supplies? Like food and stuff? That ain't nothing to get ruffled over. You find anything else?

topics.topic_text: Where did you get the robot dog?
topics.response_text: I got Rex here from a salvager a few years ago. He was a little dinged up when I got him, but one of the Followers fixed him right up.

topics.topic_text: Is there something wrong with him?
topics.response_text: He's been acting peculiar for some time now. I took him to the Followers and had him checked out, and they said his brain is bad or something.

topics.topic_text: He doesn't seem very happy.
topics.response_text: He goes through spells like this from time to time. The Followers said his brain is going bad or something.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: Sure, what's on your mind?

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about Freeside?
topics.response_text: To understand Freeside, you have to look back a few years. Originally, we were all just tribes making a living in this area.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the Kings.
topics.response_text: We're different than other gangs, and not just because we dress better. We're not just a group of thugs looking for our next fight.

topics.topic_text: I have other things to do.
topics.response_text: That's all right. My friends got beat so bad they'll be recuperating for quite some time, so head over there when you can.

topics.topic_text: Do you always charge people to come talk to you?
topics.response_text: Charge? Ha ha. Pace must be at it again. What did he take you for?

topics.topic_text: This building is... interesting. What do you know about it?
topics.response_text: Near as I can tell, it was some sort of religious institution.

topics.topic_text: Can they do anything?
topics.response_text: No, they said they don't have the tools to help him.

topics.topic_text: Is he going to be okay?
topics.response_text: For now, but they said eventually he's going to get worse. I don't know what to do.

topics.topic_text: Can I help somehow?
topics.response_text: I don't know. Maybe. If you found a way to help my poor Rex here, I'd be much obliged.

topics.topic_text: Absolutely. I'll see that he gets better.
topics.response_text: I can't thank you enough. Now, there's a few things you should know about ol' Rex here if you're going to be traveling together.

topics.topic_text: I'll pass.
topics.response_text: I completely understand. No reason you should take on someone else's problems. Let me know if you change your mind, though.

topics.topic_text: About Rex here...
topics.response_text: What about him?

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: Like what?

topics.topic_text: I think I already killed him...
topics.response_text: So it went down like that, huh? I guess it can't be helped now.

topics.topic_text: I was hoping you might have some work for me.
topics.response_text: Maybe so. Maybe so. You look like you might be able to handle yourself. Tell you what.

topics.topic_text: Orris left town after I had a little talk with him.
topics.response_text: Convinced him, huh? I could use more men with your powers of persuasion.

topics.topic_text: Will it be dangerous? I like dangerous.
topics.response_text: In that case, some of the things I need handled will be right up your alley.

topics.topic_text: I'm a little busy right now.
topics.response_text: I beg your pardon, then. I'll let you get about your business.

topics.topic: VFreeformFreesideVFSTheKingTopic046{Learned about Doc Henry and tell the King}
topics.topic_text: Julie Farkas said a man in Jacobstown can treat Rex.
topics.response_text: She said what? Why didn't she just say so when I was there? Actually, come to think of it, I was pretty angry when I went down there.

topics.topic_text: I'm afraid so.
topics.response_text: Then I must refuse. The people here have the right to do what they want and are beholden to none. I won't take that away from them.

topics.topic_text: The violence needs to stop.
topics.response_text: And whose job is it to stop it? Yours? Mine? Who are we to tell people what to do? No man has that right.

topics.topic_text: There's still time to solve this peacefully.
topics.response_text: Says the one with a squad of armed soldiers behind them. No, I don't think a peaceful solution is possible. Not anymore.

topics.topic_text: These men have orders to kill you all if you refuse. Are you sure?
topics.response_text: That I don't want to sign away my freedom and that of all the people I'm responsible for at gunpoint? Yeah, I'm sure.

topics.topic_text: And when you're dead? What will happen to their freedom then?
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Honestly, I hadn't thought it through that far. I'd guess someone would come and take over this place.

topics.topic_text: The NCR is just trying to protect its people.
topics.response_text: And I'm trying to protect mine. If the NCR wants peace so much, the first step would be to get these soldiers out of here.

topics.topic_text: Actually, they want to make you an offer.
topics.response_text: An offer, huh? All right, let's hear it.

topics.topic_text: You've got them all wrong.
topics.response_text: Wrong, huh? And I suppose they sent all of these soldiers just to make nice. Lucky me.

topics.topic_text: What if they are?
topics.response_text: Then I'm afraid we're going to have ourselves a tussle. Now say what you came to say or get out.

topics.topic_text: Freeside gets more food, water, and electricity.
topics.response_text: That doesn't sound half bad... what's the catch?

topics.topic_text: The Kings have to stop the violence against people from the NCR.
topics.response_text: Hmmm, people around here *would* be a lot less ornery if there were more supplies to go around. It'd be rough at first, but I think we could manage.

topics.topic_text: No catch. You just make sure no King attack an NCR citizen from now on.
topics.response_text: That's not so bad. I might have to make an example of a few of the more hotheaded guys, but otherwise, that sounds fair.

topics.topic_text: So why isn't every man in Freeside in your gang?
topics.response_text: We've tried to pass our philosophy on to the people of Freeside, but not everyone is ready to be a King.

topics.topic_text: I want to join the Kings.
topics.response_text: Normally, we don't let outsiders join, but I think I can make an exception in your case. I'll have one of the guys spread the word.

topics.topic_text: Can you get me into the Strip?
topics.response_text: Sure can. I have a friend who has just what you're looking for, has a shop over yonder by the east gate, named Mick & Ralph's.

topics.topic_text: I could really use some money...
topics.response_text: Caps are a little tight these days, but with our guards making more and those supplies comin' in I reckon I can spare some.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to think about it.
topics.response_text: That's a good idea. I don't give out favors everyday, so you probably shouldn't rush to pick something.

topics.topic_text: Tell me more about him.
topics.response_text: Not a whole lot to tell. There were only a few books left in here when we found it, and those were rotted away.

topics.topic_text: I wanted to talk about something else.
topics.response_text: Fine by me, just remember I owe you one. Now what did you want to talk about?

topics.topic_text: I need you to stop the violence against NCR citizens in Freeside.
topics.response_text: Whoa... that's a doozy. Truth be told, I don't even know if I can pull something like that off.

topics.topic_text: All I'm asking is that you try.
topics.response_text: I'll give it my best. You've earned that much. But this makes us even, you hear?

topics.topic_text: The Kings will follow your leadership.
topics.response_text: Damn straight they will. It's some of the other locals that I'm worried about.

topics.topic_text: Well, if you can't do it...
topics.response_text: Hold on now, I didn't say I couldn't do it, just that I couldn't guarantee it, and even that's probably stretching the truth a little.

topics.topic_text: I need you to stop the violence against NCR citizens.
topics.response_text: Is that so? That's a mighty tall order for someone I barely know. Now, if you were to help me out some, that might change my mind.

topics.topic_text: Can I join the Kings?
topics.response_text: Whoa, there. Not just anyone can be a King. First of all, we usually only accept people native to the area.

topics.topic_text: I'll head over right away.
topics.response_text: Good. I like that enthusiasm. Return when you have some information we can use.

topics.topic_text: I'll look into it when I can.
topics.response_text: Good. Return here when you've found something.

topics.topic_text: The Local men were attacked by soldiers. One of the men was identified by rank.
topics.response_text: Bunch of soldier boys, huh? They usually don't come around these parts since their big base is on the other side of the Strip.

topics.topic_text: If this was a school, what was taught here?
topics.response_text: As far as we can tell, the guy that built this place was considered the coolest of the cool, and taught other people how to be more like him.

topics.topic_text: I'm still looking into the matter.
topics.response_text: Then there's no sense in us talkin' about it.

topics.topic_text: I wanted to ask you some questions.
topics.response_text: Go ahead. Throw some questions at me.

topics.topic_text: They refuse to serve Locals.
topics.response_text: Ah, that would explain the goons. They're here to keep people like my friends away from the food. That ain't something I support. No sir.

topics.topic_text: I still haven't found anything.
topics.response_text: Keep at it. Those boys are here for a reason.

topics.topic_text: Can I ask you a few questions?
topics.response_text: Sure can. What did you want to know?

topics.topic_text: It seemed fairly innocent.
topics.response_text: Nothing's innocent in Freeside. You should know that by now.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: Sure thing. What'd you have in mind?

topics.topic_text: And that's where you got the name from.
topics.response_text: Well, that and the giant sign outside. This place could have been "The King's House of Dog Chow" and I still would have taken the name.

topics.topic_text: Is that what you guys do, pretend to be this guy?
topics.response_text: Somethin' like that, yeah. There were some working tapes here when we first got here, so we know what he sounded like.

topics.topic_text: What are you going to do?
topics.response_text: I'm gonna see that those supplies are distributed a little m{ore}- what the hell?

topics.topic_text: They said someone was sent to discuss the issue with you.
topics.response_text: Wait a minute, wait a minute. They said what?

topics.topic_text: Let's not act rashly here.
topics.response_text: Don't worry, I'm not gonna do anything uncalled for.

topics.topic_text: They said the man was severely beaten and barely survived.
topics.response_text: Huh, that would explain why they're all riled at us. Seems like we have a big misunderst{anding}- what the hell?

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about Pacer?
topics.response_text: Pace? He and I grew up together around here. We've been through a lot together, and there's no man I'd rather have at my side in a pinch.

topics.topic_text: Who are the important people in Freeside?
topics.response_text: There's me, but I don't really like talking about myself. There's Julie Farkas and the other Followers down at the ol' Mormon Fort.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about Julie Farkas.
topics.response_text: Julie represents the Followers of the Apocalypse. They're a group that tries to help people out whenever they can, so we get along just fine.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to hear about the Garret Twins.
topics.response_text: Them twins run the Atomic Wrangler, the only working casino here in Freeside. It's become pretty much{thee}the place to go around these parts.

topics.topic_text: Who are the Van Graffs?
topics.response_text: They're a family-run business from out west that deal in weapons mostly. A word of caution, though. They're not a friendly bunch. Not at all.

topics.topic_text: What's the skinny on Mick and Ralph?
topics.response_text: Mick and Ralph sell all sorts of things at a small store over by the east gate. They've done all right by us, and they'll do all right by you.

topics.topic_text: They were distributing supplies down by the old train station, but I dealt with them.
topics.response_text: I'll send some guys to check out your story, but that's some good news for a change.

topics.topic_text: I hate to tell you this, but Rex is dead.
topics.response_text: {Overwhelmed by emotion}That's... that's terrible. I hope the poor little guy gave as good as he got.{Sad, but proud}He always was a fighter.

topics.topic_text: You know, I really don't pay attention to him, so your guess is as good as mine.
topics.response_text: I expect you to treat my Rexie with a little more care. I'm expecting him back now, you hear?

topics.topic_text: He sure did.
topics.response_text: You're a man of your word, no doubt about it. I can't thank you enough.

topics.topic_text: I don't have to give him back just yet, do I?
topics.response_text: No no, you can hold onto him for a little while longer, I think. You deserve that much at least, for what you've done.

topics.topic_text: Should I leave you two alone?
topics.response_text: Naw, I'm just happy to see my pup back on his feet and happy. I can't thank you enough for this.

topics.topic_text: VMS29KingOfferStart
topics.response_text: Okay, I need some answers, now. These guys just barged in here and said they were under orders to keep me here until you arrived.

topics.topic_text: VMS29KingUltimatumStart
topics.response_text: Maybe you can tell me what the hell is going on here. These stony face bastards haven't said a word other than to say they're here under orders.

topics.topic_text: I'm here to deliver an ultimatum from the NCR. Cease hostilities against the NCR or perish.
topics.response_text: An ultimatum? Do you even know who you're talking to? We're the Kings, and no King will ever accept an ultimatum.

topics.topic_text: The NCR wants you to curb the violence in Freeside. Or else.
topics.response_text: You know, it's that "or else" part that gets stuck in my craw. It just sounds a little too much like you're trying to tell us what to do.

topics.topic_text: NCR citizens are dying in Freeside and the NCR wants you to stop it.
topics.response_text: Well, Freeside citizens are also being attacked and I'd like you all to stop it, but I'm guessing that's not going to happen, is it?

topics.topic_text: I've been instructed to offer you more resources in exchange for your word that the violence stops.
topics.response_text: That sounds fair. And all I have to do is try to tone down the attacks on the Squatters, you say?

topics.topic_text: I apologize for their rudeness. The NCR wants peace in Freeside, and offers additional supplies.
topics.response_text: And I suppose they want me to help see that happen? That seems pretty reasonable.

topics.topic_text: Don't take that tone with me. These soldiers would wipe the floor with your men.
topics.response_text: Sounds like a challenge. Boys, let's do this!

conversation.response_text: All right. I'll see you later.
Ah, my little friend has come at last. Not me, darling, though you were doing just fine.
Ladies, take five. I need to talk to my friend here.
Pace, I want you to take some guys down there and seize half of those supplies.
Rex, this is your new master. Protect him as you would me.
We'll deal with that should the time come, Pace. Now I'm sure these gentlemen are as anxious to get out of here as we are to see them go.
Lay it on me. What's going on?
Pace, this isn't really a good time to have this discussion...

combat.response_text: You best not do that again.
Now that just wasn't called for.
Now you've gone and done it.
You're treading on dangerous ground. I suggest you split.
I'm not gonna stand for that!
I reckon that don't belong to you.
